channel.title: Windows 8 Developers BETA on VirtualBox
channel.description:
Is there a way to run Win8 BETA on VirtualBox without Virtualization enabled in the BIOS? For some reason, the option to turn it on is hidden, (Something to do with the motherboard i presume).
Btw, i'm running Linux.

item.title: Windows 8 Developers BETA on VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Daginith:

I just want it on virtualbox for the hell of it (and to test out programming compatability)

Been using it since 29th February as a primary operating system, wiped Windows 7 completely. So far compatibility is very good, only found one single program which hasn’t worked which is GTA IV, which it did warn me of pre installation.

As far as programming compatibility goes, it’s 100% fine, I’m currently hosting a web server right now with xampp, mysql and all is working as expected.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8 Developers BETA on VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

ziplock:

I thought VirtualBox didn’t need virtualization hardware support?

Sadly it needs virtual acceleration. =\

Read full topic

item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I thought VirtualBox didn’t need virtualization hardware support?

item.title: Windows 8 Developers BETA on VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

xryz:

have you tried? i just used intels virtualization feature. what cpu do you have? you could try qemu you just create a qcow2 file the size you want point to it as the hdd and point to the win 8 iso as the cd i think you might need to also tell it to boot to the cd. havent used qemu in years but the last time i used it it was super simple even though it was command line.

Gemu Dosnt work with my motherboard for some reason. Keeps crashing…oh well

xI c E:

You won’t experience it as good as if you were to install it on a different partition.

I already had it on a partition at one point, but i didnt like it much, and cleared it,
I just want it on virtualbox for the hell of it (and to test out programming compatability)

Read full topic
